ADA-S009-metformin.title: Metformin as foundational therapy
ADA-S009-metformin.summary: Metformin remains a first-line agent for T2D when tolerated and eGFR ≥ 30; provides modest weight benefit; monitor B12; does not confer specific cardio-renal protection.

ADA-S009-SGLT2.title: SGLT2 inhibitors: cardiorenal and glycemic benefits
ADA-S009-SGLT2.summary: SGLT2 inhibitors reduce HF hospitalizations and slow CKD progression independent of glycemic effect; can be initiated at eGFR ≥ 20 for organ protection; glycemic efficacy decreases as eGFR falls below 45.

ADA-S009-SGLT2-CKDHF.title: SGLT2 inhibitors in CKD and heart failure
ADA-S009-SGLT2-CKDHF.summary: SGLT2 inhibitors are recommended for patients with T2D and CKD (eGFR ≥ 20) or heart failure to reduce disease progression and hospitalizations; class-wide cardiorenal benefit supported by multiple outcome trials.

ADA-S016-Periop.title: Peri-operative SGLT2 inhibitor hold
ADA-S016-Periop.summary: Hold SGLT2 inhibitors at least 3–4 days before elective surgery due to risk of euglycaemic diabetic ketoacidosis (eDKA); restart only when eating and drinking normally post-operatively.
ADA-S016-Periop.source: ADA 2026 — Diabetes Care in the Hospital (S016)

ADA-S009-GLP1.title: GLP-1 receptor agonists: MACE and weight benefits
ADA-S009-GLP1.summary: GLP-1 receptor agonists reduce major adverse cardiovascular events (MACE) in patients with established ASCVD; also provide substantial weight loss and moderate A1c reduction with low hypoglycemia risk.

ADA-S009-GLP1-ASCVD.title: GLP-1 receptor agonists and ASCVD/MACE reduction
ADA-S009-GLP1-ASCVD.summary: Multiple CVOTs (LEADER, SUSTAIN-6, REWIND, AMPLITUDE-O) demonstrate significant MACE reduction with GLP-1 RAs in T2D patients with established or high-risk ASCVD; preferred over agents without CV benefit when ASCVD is present.

ADA-S009-dual.title: Dual GIP/GLP-1 receptor agonist (tirzepatide)
ADA-S009-dual.summary: Tirzepatide (dual GIP/GLP-1 RA) provides the greatest weight loss and A1c reduction among available agents; approved for T2D and obesity; consider GI titration and cost.

ADA-S009-TZD.title: Thiazolidinediones: efficacy and safety concerns
ADA-S009-TZD.summary: Pioglitazone has high glycemic efficacy and some CV benefit but causes fluid retention, weight gain, fracture risk, and is contraindicated in heart failure (NYHA class III-IV).

ADA-S009-TZD-HF.title: Thiazolidinediones contraindicated in heart failure
ADA-S009-TZD-HF.summary: TZDs (thiazolidinediones) cause sodium and water retention and can precipitate or worsen heart failure; avoid in patients with established HF (NYHA class II–IV) due to risk of fluid overload and HF exacerbation.

ADA-S009-meglitinide.title: Meglitinides: meal-based insulin secretagogues
ADA-S009-meglitinide.summary: Meglitinides (repaglinide, nateglinide) stimulate insulin release at mealtimes; require multiple pre-meal doses; hypoglycemia risk is lower than sulfonylureas but still present; limited CV outcome data.

ADA-S016-BasalBolus.title: Basal ± prandial insulin in hospital (non-ICU)
ADA-S016-BasalBolus.summary: Scheduled basal insulin with optional prandial and correction doses is the preferred inpatient regimen for non-ICU patients with T2D; correction-only (sliding scale) insulin is not recommended as the sole inpatient strategy; target BG 140–180 mg/dL.
ADA-S016-BasalBolus.source: ADA 2026 — Diabetes Care in the Hospital (S016)

ADA-S016-IV.title: IV insulin infusion in the ICU
ADA-S016-IV.summary: Continuous IV insulin infusion using validated protocols is recommended for critically ill patients; target BG 140–180 mg/dL in the ICU; transition to subcutaneous insulin when patient is stable and eating.
ADA-S016-IV.source: ADA 2026 — Diabetes Care in the Hospital (S016)

ADA-S009-DPP4.title: DPP-4 inhibitors: efficacy and CV neutrality
ADA-S009-DPP4.summary: Modest glycemic efficacy; generally CV-neutral. Avoid saxagliptin in HF.

ADA-S009-SU.title: Sulfonylureas and hypoglycemia
ADA-S009-SU.summary: High glycemic efficacy but increased hypoglycemia and weight gain; caution in older adults and CKD.

ADA-S009-AGI.title: α-Glucosidase inhibitors
ADA-S009-AGI.summary: Postprandial effect; modest A1c reduction; GI side effects common.

ADA-S009-colesevelam.title: Colesevelam
ADA-S009-colesevelam.summary: Modest A1c reduction; constipation common; can raise triglycerides.

ADA-S009-bromocriptine.title: Bromocriptine-QR
ADA-S009-bromocriptine.summary: Modest glycemic efficacy; orthostasis and nausea may limit use.

ADA-S009-pramlintide.title: Pramlintide
ADA-S009-pramlintide.summary: Adjunct to insulin; nausea common; reduce insulin to avoid hypoglycemia.

ADA-S009-insulin.title: Insulin class notes
ADA-S009-insulin.summary: High efficacy but increased hypoglycemia and weight gain; analogs reduce nocturnal hypoglycemia vs NPH.

ADA-S016-insulin.title: Inpatient insulin approach
ADA-S016-insulin.summary: Prefer basal ± prandial insulin inpatient; premixed is less flexible and associated with more hypoglycemia.
ADA-S016-insulin.source: ADA 2026 — Diabetes Care in the Hospital (S016)

ADA-S016-GLP1-periop.title: GLP-1 RAs & anesthesia
ADA-S016-GLP1-periop.summary: Peri-anesthesia caution due to GI effects and delayed gastric emptying; individualize plans.
ADA-S016-GLP1-periop.source: ADA 2026 — Diabetes Care in the Hospital (S016)
